div.h1: April 24th Updates on the Coronavirus--End of School Year Update

span.span: April 24th updates on the CoronaVirus

On April 17th Governor Kim Reynolds made the decision to close schools for the remainder of the 2019-20 school year. Although this is disappointing we do understand it is necessary to ensure the safety of our students, staff and community members. As stated in earlier messages, the closure of the building does not mean school resources will be shut down for the summer. Below are some things that you need to know as we work through this pandemic crisis.
Continuous Learning

As we have done since the school was closed on March16th, our school will offer voluntary learning for our students. This means that all activities are optional, no grade will be given, and attendance is not required. However, it is very important that parents continue to encourage their children to take advantage of the resources that are provided by their children’s teachers. If you ever have any questions about any of your children’s classes please contact their teacher. REMINDER: YOUR CHILDREN SHOULD STAY ENGAGED IN LEARNING UNTIL THE END OF THE SCHOOL YEAR.
High School Registration

If your student is entering high school next school year it is necessary for them to log on to JMC and select the classes they are wanting to take. This needs to be done prior to May 1. Everyone who has not selected classes prior to May will have courses selected for them based upon availability of space. Please refer to the emails sent by high school counselor Jacob Hedger for information.
Grading for the second semester: (Tentative, pending school board approval)
Elementary students second semester grade will be the grade that they had received at the end of the 3rd quarter.

Due to the COVID-19 crisis, the Logan-Magnolia Jr./Sr. High School is amending its grading policy for the 2nd semester of the 2019-2020 school year for all courses except those courses taken through Iowa Western Community College or courses through our credit recovery program, Edgenuity. The following final grade options will be enacted:

1. Students who successfully met content expectations through the 3rd quarter: These students will receive the letter grade earned from the 3rd quarter. However, students may convert their final grade using one of the following options:
• Option 1: Keep your current grade: The student does not have to do anything. The administration will automatically enter the 3rd quarter grade.
• Option 2: Convert the current grade to a Pass (P) mark for credit: The student must actively reach out to each teacher in which they want to convert their final grade by May 15.

em.strong: Why should I choose to take a Pass score (P) as a final grade?

span.span: • The P (passing) mark does not positively or negatively affect your GPA.
• If your 3rd quarter grade is lower than your normal average grade, you may want to choose to take the P as a final score so you do not negatively hurt your GPA.

• Option 3: Retake the course during the 20-21 school year. The student needs to notify the guidance counselor for proper class registration for the 20-21 school year. The score earned during the retake will be the final score and be recorded on the student’s official transcript.
2. Students who have not successfully met content expectations through the 3rd quarter:

Students will NOT earn a failing score for the second semester. Instead, students who are identified as not meeting content standards will receive no credit in the classes in which they are currently unsatisfactory, and NC (No Credit) will be recorded in JMC. Students who have not successfully met content expectations through the 3rd quarter have two options:

​​​​​​​Option 1: Retake the course during the 2nd semester of the 20-21 school year. If the course is a full-year course, required for graduation, and/or required for next-level learning (ie, English 9, Alg I, etc.), the student will not be allowed to move on to the next level until the 2nd semester is completed successfully. If the course is a single semester course, not required for graduation, and/or a course not required for next-level learning, the student will keep the NC as a final mark until the class is retaken. Should the student not retake the course, the NC will remain and credit will not be earned.

​​​​Option 2: Retake the 2nd semester course during our summer school session using our online program, Edgenuity. This course must be completed prior to the start date of the 20-21 school year. If the student has not successfully completed the online class to 100% completion, the student will not be allowed to remove the NC as a final grade. Therefore, the student will not be allowed to take the next level of course work and will be required to take the course during the 2nd semester of the 20-21 school year. If you decide to take your course through Edgenuity, you must contact Mrs. Gochenour, cgochenour@lomaschools.org.
If the student does not successfully meet the content standards, Mrs. Gochenour will be contacting both the student and parent/guardian to discuss the above options.

u.strong: Graduation, prom, spring activities, and summer activities:

span.span: As of today, we are planning on having an audio/video event on May 16th. What this will look like is still to be determined. An on-site graduation will be scheduled for a date in June or July if possible.

Prom will not be hosted by our school this spring. However, there is a group of parents who are working to give the juniors and seniors a dance sometime during the summer. This is also something that we do not have a lot of details as of today.
All spring sports and activities have been cancelled for the spring semester. The summer activities will be determined by the state on June 1st.
iPads:

Students in grades 7-12 will be allowed to keep their iPads over the summer. This is to encourage summertime learning. For example, some students may need to make up some classes or may want to improve their grade through Edgenuity, an online course recovery program.
iPads given to parents of elementary students need to be returned by the end of the present school year.

We will be developing a schedule which will allow students to pick up their personal property. This schedule will be sent to you sometime in the next couple of weeks. During this time, students will need to turn in any school property they have at home. This would include library books, uniforms, textbooks, etc.

The lunch program has been a much-appreciated resource for our families in need. We will continue to run this program every day until the end of the school year. We do not know if this federal program will be continued into the summer months.

This pandemic has been challenging for all of us. Thus far, I have been proud of our students, staff, parents, and community for how they all have worked together to make it through this crisis. We will get through this and as the months turn from May into June we hope to put this episode behind us and start looking forward to a great 2020-21 school year.
